titleStmt.title: The deputation of angels, or, The angell-guardian: I. Proved by the dim light of nature, clear beames of Scriptures, and consent of many ancient and modern writers, untainted with popery. II. Cleared from many rubs and mistakes; the criticall queries of antagonists examined, untyed. III. Applyed and improved, for our information in many other truths; consolation in our adversities; and reformation of our lives. Chiefly grounded on Acts 12. 15. It is his angell. / By Robert Dingley, M.A. and minister of the word at Brixton in the isle of Wight; formerly Fellow of Magdalen Colledge in Oxford.
titleStmt.author: Dingley, Robert, 1619-1660.

titleStmt.title: The deputation of angels, or, The angell-guardian: I. Proved by the dim light of nature, clear beames of Scriptures, and consent of many ancient and modern writers, untainted with popery. II. publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T.R. for Edw. Dod, and are to be sold at the signe of the Gun in Ivie Lane,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Nouember 1.7." the 4 in the imprint date has been crossed out and replaced with "53".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
